result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason L Stendahl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft by Contractor <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 779.02(5).
  • Theft by Contractor <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 779.02(5).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Defendant shall have no contact with E.K. or his residence other than contact through proceedings in regards to a pending civil case.
Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent.

timeConds.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

Sentencing hearing on June 13, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Def in person & by Atty John A Best.  Atty Peter John Cannon appeared for State. State moves to amend to 2 counts of misd theft by contractor contrary to 779.02(5) and 943.20(3)(a), Court so orders; Partial joint recommendation: Ct 1 - 9 months jail with huber imposed and stayed for 2 years of probation, OCOP, $243 cc, Ct 2 - 6 months jail with huber consecutive to Ct 1 imposed and stayed for 2 years of probation, $243 cc, OCOP, free to argue condition time (state recommends 25 days jail with huber) No contest plea entered on Ct 1 and Ct 2 as amended; Court accepts no contest plea and finds defendant guilty;  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 13, 2016 at 09:00 am.
